Q: On what kind of ships do students study?.

A: Scolarships.

Q: Why can't your nose be 12 inches long?

A: Because then it would be a foot.

Q: Why did the scarecrow get an award?

A: He was outstanding in his field.

Q: Where in the world do pencils come from?

A: Pennsylvania.

Q: What do you get if you cross a snowman with a Vampire?

A: Frostbite.

Q: What do you call a T-Rex's bruise?

A: A dino-sore.

Q: When the smog lifts in Los Angeles, what happens?

A: UCLA.

Q: Why do bicycles fall over?

A: Because they are two-tired.

Q: What did Billy say after he learned how to count money?

A: It all makes cents now.

Q: Why did the man take off his door bell?

A: He wanted to win the NoBell prize.

Q: What do you call a fake noodle?

A: An impasta.
